text: The Vegan is amazing, and I have dreams of it at night! It is a decent sized healthy meal for $5, and I am so glad they have currently added more hours espcially at night!

Great food! Meat & cheese arepas and cheese empanadas were great. And the proper Venezuelan charisma is one of the main attractions as well. As a Venezuelan you'll feel like home. If you're not Venezuelan, you will enjoy a great example of our typical cuisine.
Id drive to Vegas for this.. I do drive to Vegas for there vegan arepa.. Ecstacy in a little sandwich with lots of love.

#1 Pabellon is awesome. The plantains make it. The sweetness goes great with the shredded beef and cilantro sauce. Waited 15 minutes for my order (not crowded either) but well worth it. Made fresh. Will go back again.
I have had the vegan, the vegetarian, and chicken arepa.  They were fantastic.  Pure yummy goodness!

I am glad we found Rika Arepas. We were in the east side of Flamingo wanted to try something new. Noticed the sign and read the reviews. Went for it and WE LOVED IT. The restaurant is small and coZy We were greeted right away. We ordered the Pabellon Arepa, Cachapa and 2 Passion Fuit Juices. 

The pabellon arepa is huge lots of flavor and worth the price. The cachapa is a corn pancake with cheese. Very interesting flavor tangy and sweet. The passion fruit juice hit the spot. 

Love the attention and friendly service. The arepas and food take time but its worth the wait. 

Plenty of parking.

Saw this place looking for something for lunch. The food is amazing and very inexpensive. They have a meal for $10 that comes with a drink,any sandwich, and plantains. They also have vegan and vegetarian options avaliable. I believe it is family owned and the people who work there are very nice and speak English well. The enviroment is a little small so it is probably good for one crowd of about 10 but, no more than that and the music is kinda loud but the food is amazing.If your looking for some amazing Venezuelan food I highly recommend this place.

If you are looking for a traditionally delicious authentic Venezuelan restaurant this is it! The food is amazing! Very flavorful! Yo can't go wrong with anything on the menu! You will be happy you tried them out and adding them to a regular restaurant stop!!!!!! Enjoy!!!!!

I can't even handle how good this arepa is...

First of all: these guys are not hard to find.
Why not? Because if you look at their FB page it tells you exactly where they are going to be that day. Not hard.

Seriously that first time I tried them I tracked them Downtown and the arepa was sooo fresh and yummy that the bread had just been baked. Yes I was there at 10:30am waiting :)
It was sooo good that Tuesday morning that I took hubby to the Farmers Market at Town Center that night around 5pm and yep I got another one also. Still full from that morning and due to the size, I could only eat half, what a sin! 

Super sweet customer service. They asked me how I knew about them and after I told them they said Amanda M. is an amazingly nice customer. 

So far I have tried their passion fruit juice and their mango juice. Both are of course good but SUPER DUPER sweet, too sweet for me. I'm not a fan but you should try it yourself. They are def yummy. 

I get only the #4 and never get tired of it. Warning this item is big, if you are not starving you might as well bring a friend to share it or cut it in half and try to save it for later? It's such a good deal at $6 wow.

The cucumber yummy sauce is super good (the sando does not need the sauce) I dip chips in it sometimes. The red sauce is not my fav. I'm not a fan of chipotle or anything "smoky" tasting. Try it yourself you might like it.

There is not much else to say other than:
If you have not tried this place out...seriously you are missing out. I think it helped make my life a little more complete!
Thanks Amanda!
Viva las arepas is way better the maza was hard and it wasn't all that good the place is small and they don't have public restrooms

Let me start out by saying that the fact that this place has the word Express in its name is a complete JOKE.
As I write this, I have waited over 30 minutes for a vegetarian arepa.... so no I am not waiting for the meat to cook.

They didn't have change for a minor cash transaction.

I ordered a coke, in a can....
Got it after about 20 minutes. 
This is a tiny little place with 3
Or 4 tables, no wait service.

3 Stars because the food was good. I have def. had better and I don't know if it was worth the wait.

Rika Arepa Express has upgraded from a food truck to a brick and mortar location on the East side! Arepa lovers everywhere should be rejoicing, because RAE's eats are delicious. Go traditional with the Pabellon or riff on chicken salad with the Reina, or stick to your specialized diet with vegetarian and vegan options! 

For my first visit to this new location, I tried the chicken and sausage combo of the La Surena and it didn't disappoint: a hot packed pocket with creamy avocado slices, spicy sausage, and shredded chicken, which I smothered in their cilantro and spicy sauces. But because I'm a total glutton, I had to add on a beef empanada, which was also damn delicious. 

Location has a few tables to dine-in and service is friendly. They have an $11 lunch combo that includes an arepa, plantains, and drink, as well as some breakfast options for early visitors. I am hoping they do well here in their new home!

My big taste find today was the Venezulean Food Truck called The Rika Arepa Express.  They had chicken, shredded beef and pork sandwiches somewhat like an empanada.  They give out little taster samples the size of a quarter and that gives you a good idea of what to expect.  I chose to order the #1 Reina Pepiada which is Shredded Chicken Breast, Avocado, Peas and mayo.  That one is served cold like a chicken salad.  I followed that with a Passion Fruit juice.  It was a refreshing lunch.  They were very friendly.  I had a taste of the #3 which was a shredded pork sandwich and that will probably be my choice next time.  Very good food, fresh and nice new tastes to experience.

I was looking for a new place to try empanadas. OMG I found another place. The service was outstanding. I asked the cashier for recommendations. She even threw in a few appetizers for us to try. This place is delicious. So full of flavor. Will definitely be coming back again!

Rica, deliciosa, sabrosa... just a few fitting words to describe the arepas at Rika Arepa Express! I tracked down this Venezuelan food truck at the Downtown 3rd Farmers Market on Friday and I was instantly impressed by the prompt, friendly service and flavors of the food that I tried. Thank you to my good friend Christie O. for spotting this truck at another local farmers market and mentioning it in a quick tip!

The picture menu featuring 9 filled arepas is easy to navigate. Each one costs $4.00 or $4.50. I ordered the Domino for myself and Reina Pepiada (creamy chicken and avocado salad) to bring home to my husband, and a passion fruit juice to drink. The addition of perfect, creamy avocado slices for $1 made the Domino even better, named after the contrast of the white mozzarella cheese and savory black beans. I could eat a whole bowl of the black beans; they are seasoned just the way I like them, with lots of cumin, and not overwhelmed by any other flavor. After my first bite, I remembered the red and green sauce included with my order and poured them over my following bites. I especially enjoyed the creamy cilantro sauce with its fresh herb flavor. The parchita (passion fruit juice) was great, though my cup contained more ice than I would have liked. I really enjoyed my meal on the patio outside the former bus terminal that now houses the DT3 Farmers Market.

I can't comment on the meats here, as you couldn't even pay me to eat a steak cooked by Gordon Ramsay himself. However, my husband approved of his Reina Pepiada. Look for Rika Arepa Express at First Friday and StrEATs this month-- I think it will be love at first bite when you taste their ¡sazón! (Just not in the Lorena Garcia for Taco Bell way.)

Heard Rika was going to be at Bad Beat Brewing on 08/09/14 so we decided we DEFINITELY had to get down there. Rika's not frequently in Henderson so we definitely had to take advantage. 
This place is delicious. I ordered the shredded beef arepa and the chicken/sausage arepa. Both were delicious. Served hot and with a side of fried plantains. The chicken/sausage was my favorite. The arepa itself is slightly crispy on the outside which makes it a perfect little pocket for all those delicious fillings they put in there. 
I have not been to the "other" arepa spot in town, but I've had Rika three times and can honestly say I frequently look at their calendar in hopes that they will be near me. Their drinks are delicious and the arepas are pretty close to perfect. The owners are also always very friendly and helpful.
Delicious food! The Arepas, Empanadas, Mandoca, Tequeños and the Passion Fruit juice were fabulous! Im coming back for more. The owners are super nice. We will definitely be back for more!!

The Arepas were amazing and the empanadas... n words for it! delicious!!!! This place has some of the best food I have ever had and I tried many types of food. I usually don't write reviews but this place definitely deserves one. Also, service is super friendly!

So I came here the other day because I was around the way. I had this place on my bookmarks list for a long time and always wanted to try. It's a small place with 4 - 5 tables and it was pretty clean. 

Staff was really nice and took care of me rather quickly. There was only one person there when I arrived. I ended up ordering the vegan option arepa which consisted of black beans, avocado, & sweet plantains and my kids ordered a grilled chicken & cheese arepa. My order literally took forever. I must have waited 30 minutes to receive my order. The lady even forgot to give me my drinks, I had to go back up to the counter to get them. 

When I finally received my order my food was good but nothing special. I was expecting a lot more flavor especially in the beans. Even the green sauce was a bit bland. My kids had the chicken arepa. We asked them for only chicken & cheese because my kids are picky. When we received it, there were greens inside and I had to pick them out. Also it was super greasy. There was hot grease leaking from the bottom. My kids couldn't finish it. I had no idea grilled chicken contained so much grease. 

Im not sure if it was just a bad day for them or this is how it normally is, but I think people should give this place a try and see if they have a different experience. I on the other hand don't believe I will be returning unless I'm in the area. And even then I'm not sure if I will.

This review is only for the Hallacas (traditional Christmas food), as I haven't tried the Arepas here yet.

Overall, I'd say they're ok. The flavor was good, but the dough (masa) was a bit soggy. Usually it should be a bit firmer. I was a bit dissappointed, but will give it another shot, as the flavor was good. Maybe there was just an off batch. I'll be back to try the Hallacas again, and the arepas. If they're better, I'll update my review.
We love this place..! Omg arepa are so good..! Highly recommended... nice variety on the menu, excellent customer service...

This place is awesome, we have been there twice and the food and service are top notch. If you want to taste the best Venezuelan food in town you don't need to look anywhere else this is the place to go without hesitation!!!
Excellent! We had the Arepa de Pabellón, tequeños and cachapa -  an authentic taste of Venezuela.  Good prices. Highly recommended.

So yummy and portions are large. Well worth the price. Jose is excellent and hospitable.  They deserve patronage.  Quality of food is amazing for a food truck.  The sauce s are great in flavor and spice.

My first arepa ever. I've always wanted to try one just never got the chance. Holy cow sooo yum. The Pernil arepa was amazing and huge! Could barely finish one. Wish my tummy space was bigger so I could have another.
Tried this spot for the first time And ordered the the #4Vegan option. It was so delicious and fresh! Great customer service too.

Highly recommend this place! Ridiculously delicious food! The vegan and vegetarian arepas are really rich in flavor. The dough in the arepa is the perfect mix between soft and crunchy. The dough in he cachapa tastes like pure corn, too! The portions are satisfying. I really love the Friendly staff and overall great service! Oooh, also try the passion fruit juice!

came here to check out the food on a Sunday. It was not very busy so we got our order pretty quick. All the arepas look very appetizing but I came for the beef soup. We placed our order around 3pm and when it came I noticed the soup had very little beef. I was disappointed and let the waitress know, she said that as the day went by it had disintegrated a bit into the rest of the soup so there was little beef. With that aside, the soup was very tasty and very good just disappointed I couldn't have more beef. The cachapa was very filling and tasty, the mandocas were great for $1! My bill was pretty pricey for what I ate and it was the soup that made it that expensive. I would come back but not getting the soup for that price.

Found the truck outside Bad Beat Brewing and ordered a delicious arepa to eat with my beer.

I wasn't really sure what an arepa was, but food trucks more often than not hit the spot. However, now that I know what an arepa is, and how well Rika Arepa Express makes them, they can go ahead and park on my driveway. For Free. Seriously.

I think they've changed the menu items up, or at least the order of them, based on other pictures and reviews here, because I could have sworn I had a #1, but it was shredded beef with plantains, black beans, and cheese. And I did NOT regret my choice. So good. I think what makes these arepas are the plantains, so I highly suggest to pick one with that in it. You can also add some items for an additional charge, like avocado, if it doesn't already come on your arepa.

Service here is slooooow and when I say slow I mean we waited 40 minutes for an order of 2 arepas. Kind of irritating but the arepas made up for it.

I got the pabellon because my taste buds love anything with a combo of sweet and savory. Shredded beef, beans, plantains, and cheese. Soooo good. They're pretty big in size, I actually had to take my other half to go. I love the way it taste with both the green and red sauce. 

The lady taking orders felt bad because of how long the food was taking so she gave us a free order of the breadsticks with the cheese in the middle. They were good but still, the service was slow. I think they need to hire another worker because there was only one person in the back cooking and one in the front taking orders. There was probably 7 other people waiting for their food too.

Having had this business bookmarked for a while, I finally tracked them down at First Friday last month. I'm no expert with arepas, but thought the two I tried were excellent. At six dollars each, I thought they'd be on the smaller side, but after receiving them I began to wonder how I would finish them. I loved the interplay of savory and sweet in the Pabellon ($6). It was overflowing with black beans, shredded beef, sweet plantains, mozzarella, and cilantro sauce in a masa pocket. The Pernil ($6) was just as good with the pulled pork, black beans, cheese and guacamole providing salty, sweet, and savory notes throughout each bite. I tried to finish both but failed. Large portions, cheap prices, good eats... you can't beat that.

I had these arepas last week. 

First of all, their arepas variations was pretty wide, offering anything from meaty arepas to vegan/vegetarian selections. The staff makes sure that their delightful arepas are targeted to a wide audience, and it shows. 

Now, the quality of the arepas is outstanding. The owners really put a lot of care into their craft, using their freshest ingredients into their arepas. My expectations were really neutral towards the place, but the flavor really won me over. 

A must try

I had a craving for something different at First Friday and saw this truck. There was a small line and that gave me time to read the menu, which is part of the wrap of the truck. A toss up between pulled pork and chicken I decided on chicken. This arepa was the #7. Grilled chicken, mozzarella cheese, fresh greens and a chimi churri sauce. It was a good 20 minute wait and I was getting inpatient. The long wait was due to the fact that the couple in front of us ordered about 8 to go. The other reason is they grill the chicken to order. I am definitely fine with waiting on fresh chicken to be be grilled rather than some that was already cooked. The tastes were amazing. Each bit give you just enough of the ingredients listed above in between the warm arepa. It was a lot of food and I had trouble finishing one.

1st time eating here, let me tell you, I was a little overwhelmed not knowing what to order. The amazing young lady taking the order really knew the food to help me and my family find what to order. She even brought out some tequenos for us to try, which I will now order EVERYTIME we go. They were crispy golden perfection. We also ordered 3 different arepas- one with all mozzarella cheese, the Pollo adobo and the Pabellon. All 3 were amazingly delish. We're kinda picky when it come to sauce, they brought out the sauce on the side for us to explore. My husband definitely loved the spicy sauce, I love the cilantro one but all where really fresh and good.
The atmosphere was super cool and the place was really clean. Staff all made sure we had what we needed and where very welcoming. We will be back, definitely my new favorite!

The food was delicious and the service excellent! 
I was super excited to try Venezuelan food and this was everything and more 
I'm definitely coming back

This was my first time eating Rika Arepa Express and it was BEYOND AMAZING!!! I have never tasted anything like it and it was SO flavorful! I would highly recommend the #2 and one of their yummy fruit drinks. They give you 20oz of the freshest juice and it is only $2. Such a deal! The portions are huge as well. If you are a fairly light eater you could easily share one. The owner is also very nice and helpul. Service is great.

I absolutely love this place. They used to be a food truck years ago and then started popping up at farmers markets. I haven't seen them in a while until I stumbled upon their restaurant a couple weeks ago. So glad I did! Their food is amazing!!

After the ass service from Snowballs I found Rika Arepa's food truck in the same farmers market!  I've never seen them here before so I had to try it.  I asked if they were related to the Arepa's downtown and they said no.  Oh well, I loved Viva Las Arepas and this one isn't as bad too!  

I ordered a beef and pork.  I added cheese to them and they were so good.  You get two sauces packed with your order if you have it to go and the staff is nice and explained everything to me.  The Arepa tasted homemade and was flaky, nice.  Look out for this food truck at Farmers Market!

Great Arepa!
The outside bread was warm and crispy. I ordered the Reina. Which was full of chicken salad, peas and slices of fresh avocado. I added cheese, so glad I did. The passion fruit juice was so amazing! Must get! Super refreshing and sweet for a hot day.
The mandocas were really tasty. The combo of bananas and cheese seemed kinda off, but it was actually really good. They came out piping hot and crispy, and filling was savory, with just a hint of sweetness. Great partner to my arepa, just like the yummy cilantro sauce.
This place is kind of out of the way, but will be back to try other flavors!

Where have I've been?  Why did it take me so long to have arepas?  These are just a few questions that I had to ask myself after I had my first bite of their Pabellon.  A few weeks ago was my first time to try Rika Arepa Express and also my first time to have arepas.  Because I have no comparison, Rika Arepa Express is as good as it gets. 

So what's the big deal?  Lets start with the size of their Arepas. Their Pabellon (shredded beef, black beans, cheese, and plantains) is ginormous. The Pabellon is packed with about 3 oz of perfectly seasoned and shredded beef. There is no way you will be disappointed with this one if you're a carnivore like me.  Stuff black beans, the cheese, and plantains and it's a match made in heaven.  Although all of this is good on its own, it's Rika's arepas that makes this meal a big deal.  The arepas is a flat bread made of corn and served warm with a little crunch to it.  My goodness...I couldn't wait to come back.  I didn't wait too long for round 2 and came back a few weeks later.  This time I had their Pollo Asado (chicken, mozzarella, and their Rika Chimi-churri sauce).  The Pollo Asado was pretty good, but I thought it needed more meat.  My opinion, the Pabellon was better.  Lesson learned...I will stick with what I like.  

Pabellon ($6.00):  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=AulzUqyw86jIqrRrBqrf-g&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ

Pollo Asado ($6.50):  http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=oe6pZk2_yxkfvo0vtG47Gg&userid=y3FcL4bLy0eLlkb0SDPnBQ

Tip To Self:  I love how their arepas are warm and crispy. I may even ask if they can keep it grilled a little longer for some extra crunch.



YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE - (023/366)

It's a truck... it's a tent... it's a brick-and-mortar!

Yep, Rika Arepa Express has now settled into a stationary home. They're in a very nondescript plaza on Flamingo near Sandhill. This is great! Not only have I always longed for more Venezuelan food options ever since trying out the original Rika Arepa Express truck, but this side of town (especially this section of Flamingo) has been sorely lacking for non-chain food in general ever since I've been here.

Prices are a bit higher than I recall, but the Pabellón ($8.50) is still as enjoyable as it was when I last tried their tent (in other words, still not the same as the old truck). It came out quickly and was piping hot. The arepa dough is almost sturdy enough to hold all the fillings to the end, and the combo of shredded beef, black beans, plantains, and mozzarella is a classic. The cilantro sauce and mild chipotle sauce aren't show-stealing but should be used generously to maximize satisfaction.

I would've been satiated with the arepa alone, but I had to add on a couple of sides for scientific purposes. The Tequeño ($1 each) is a dough-wrapped stick of non-stringy, semi-crumbly-yet-soft cheese, and it's the superior choice. The Empanada ($3.50) comes with beef, chicken (my choice), or cheese filling, but none of that is too relevant because the dough is too thick, too gummy inside, and not flavorful on its own or even with the aforementioned sauces. It's far worse than my favorite local Venezuelan empanada, which comes from a food truck that's still in operation.

I'm glad that Rika Arepa Express is now regularly available in this particular neighborhood, even if it's not quite as good as the original. The arepa is a fast, hearty meal, and this place is the only option that comes to mind if I don't feel like visiting one of my favorite Thai restaurants. I'll either try the La Sureña arepa (chicken, smoked sausage) or perhaps a plate next time.

This place is a little hidden gem. The flavors are authentic if you are Venezuelan (like me), or a wonderful discovery if this food is new to you. Everything is not only tasty and truly delicious, but also you can tell it was made with dedication and love. The place is clean and cozy, and the owner is wonderful as well. Can't recommend it enough, you need to try it! Specially the arepas and tequeños, which are addictive. 5 well-deserving stars.

Delicious!  I order the #11 - Pabellon.  At $6, this is my score of the year!  This fantastic arepa is overflowing with moist, FULL of flavor beef, black beans, sweet plantains and cheese.  It came to two side sauces - a mild and creamy delicious cilantro and an awesome spicy red sauce.  Try this food truck NOW!  :-)

I've never had Venezuelan food and I was kind of skeptic at first because it was small venue. However everything we ordered was amazing. The staff was super nice too!

Everything we ordered was made fresh and was so tasty. We will def be coming back!

I had the pleasure of enjoying one of these amazing arepas at the Inspirada Farmer's Market. What a truly tasty treat!

Their stand was nicely set up with two clear menu boards on each side of the front table. All of the arepa options were listed with all of the included ingredients to help make your choice. Most of the arepas are $8.50. There is also an option to turn it into a combo that would include sweet plantains and passion fruit juice for about $12. Pricing seems reasonable for the quality and portions.

The #1 arepa was calling my name. The arepa itself was tender and delicious. The inside was stuffed with black beans, plantains, shredded beef, and mozzarella. The rika sauce was also delicious and the icing on the cake. Each individual ingredient was very tasty and the flavors were great together as well. I tried the passion fruit juice and that was very refreshing. It had the perfect amount of sweetness.

I ordered twice, once for myself to enjoy on the spot and later to take one home to my husband. Both times the wait was just over five minutes. The woman taking orders advised me of this before I paid so it wasn't a big deal.

The food was great i ordered the avocado chicken sandwich & the combo plate . The staff was very friendly & helpful. The avocado chicken sandwich comes with two sauces one green one red I didn't really like the red one but the green one was exceptional . The inside was clean and their is a lot of parking didn't wait long for the food I'll be back definitely. The avocado chicken sandwich is very filling

Loved this place so much!! Everyone was super friendly even the other guest waiting for our food :) I got the #1 with no cheese and will def be back for more!! Loved the shredded beef and plantains it's one of my favorite foods growing up and they made it just how I remember! def great place for a yummy arepa!!!
This is truly excellent Venezuelan food! Great food, great customer service, super cle an. Love it!!!!

Thanks to Amanda M. for leading me to this delicious truck.  I ordered 2 arepas to try: the vegan and the pabellano.

The cashier actually let me try a sample since I was a first-timer.  I got to try a sizeable hunk of a chicken arepa.  The vegan has black beans, sweet plantains and avocado.  The pabellano has shredded beef, sweet plantains, black beans and cheese.  I love avocado and plantains, so I had to get these 2.

My basket of arepas came with a spicy red salsa and a creamy cilantro sauce.  I liked both, but the red one was perfect with both arepas.  I liked both sauces on the pabellano.  The pabellano was so warm, with tangy meat mixing with sweet plantain - the beans and cheese rounded out the dish.  This one I will probably get every time, should Rika Arepa Express not always be on the opposite side of town.

The vegan was creamy with the avocado and had a ton of beans.  Once again, plantains made it!  This probably was the first time I had avocado and plantain flavors mixing together, but it worked.  The prices were very reasonable ($5 for vegan and $6 for pabellano).  Some of the arepas are $4ish, but I of course picked the specials (see my pic of specials on menu).  Overall, yummy and filling.  I look forward to the next time!
Food was way better than I expected!! So delicious!!!! Will be coming here often! I had the Vegan with Tequeños & passion fruit drink!
Very nice people !! Family restaurant and home made recipes I totally recommend this place very clean and the food delicious.

I have been looking for a good Venezuelan restaurant in Vegas for a while now so I was delighted when I heard Rika Arepa Express was opening up a location. The first thing I noticed and really liked about the restaurant was the bright colors and pictures of different places in Venezuela. Upon walking in, I was eagerly greeted by the friendly cashier. She was very helpful in explaining things on the menu and letting me try items I was unfamiliar with. I had a hard time choosing because everything looked so appetizing. I finally decided on getting the number 1 (the Pabellon). I do not exaggerate when I say that I was transported to a different dimension. The flavor was so incredibly rich and I could taste the quality of every single ingredient. To top it off, both of the sauces were so delicious I could literally drink them. The actual arepa was incredibly soft and warm, and the combination of shredded beef and sweet plantains is to die for. I have since tried everything on the menu and every arepa is equally as mouthwatering. The tequenos and empanadas are fried to perfection and are especially good with the heavenly sauces. 

Overall I had a wonderful experience! They have great service and even better food!! It's by far the best in town and a must have when coming to Vegas!

Dining with Rika was my first official arepa experience. When I heard they were set up at First Friday while I was there, I knew that was going to be my food destination for the evening and fortunately, it was close. My friend and I were reading the menu as we approached the truck and were offered a sample of their popular Reina Pepiada Arepa while deciding. Well, we didn't have to look much further because it was delicious and it reeled both of us in. I was initially weary of the cold filling, but that was quickly pushed aside by its wonderful flavors. It had the standard shredded chicken breast, avocado, green peas, mayonnaise, and parsley. There was also a bottle of creamy green sauce to accompany your arepas and it was really great, however, there was no way to take it with you (it would have been nice to have it throughout the arepa and not just in the beginning). We really enjoyed the arepas and it was deceivingly filling! So, if you see their truck at an event, make sure you stop by.

This is the first time I've seen the Rika Arepa Express food truck near my work place and I couldn't find any reviews on yelp, so i'm assuming they are new. Anyway, I googled the name and found their website, where you can find pictures of their products. I was looking toward to munch on some empanadas for lunch but they didn't have any. They told me that they only have empanadas on special occasions. If that is the case, they should have noted on their website about it and when is the heck they consider "special occasion" !!! Another thing that rubbed me the wrong way is that they charged tax separately on the products (other food trucks I dealt with usually included tax in their price already), so I ended up with so much coins in my pockets and the time they sort out coins make wait time longer.

Now that I got the anger out of my system, let's talk about the food. Since I couldn't order the empanadas because it's not "special occasion", I ended up ordered a #3 (stewed pork) and #4 (stew shredded beef) arepas. I didn't have high expecation and was just hoping that it's close to the arepas I tried at Viva Las Arepas on Las Vegas Blvd. I was floored when I took the first few bites. Damn, the arepas were good and actually much better than the one at Viva Las Arepas. The bun itself was fresh and not over-oily like the one over at Viva Las Arepas. The pork and beef meats were flavorful, juicy, and not salty like the other place. 

Overall, I love it and will definitely come back here for arepas. The price is not bad either. The pork arepa is $3.50 + tax, and the beef arepa is $4 + tax. Here is the memo to R.A.E owners, have tax included in the price and round it up to like $4 for pork arepa and $4.50 for beef. Also try to include empanadas in your menu if you have it listed on your website. Ohh, another thing, if you don't take credit card, don't have it listed on your website either. A co-worker of mine had to run to the nearby ATM and pay ATM fee just to get some cash to pay for it when he was told they don't take credit card even though their website said they do take it.

This place is amazing! What made it so great? The service me and my friends received. The owner was there and she was very friendly. She took her time explaining the dishes and ingredients. We also talked a little bit about her hometown in Venezuela. I learned a lot about the food!

I ordered a sandwich made with patacones (fried plantains) as the buns. This is a dish I saw on their Instagram but that they don't have on the menu yet. If you go there, please ask for this because it is amazing. The flavors are on point and it is also very filling. 

We also tried the tequeños and loved them. This is a great side dish that I would urge you not to miss! I am definitely coming back to this place and bringing the hubby. The dish really reminded me to a Puerto Rican dish called el jibarito. They are both amazing!

Such a cute little restaurant in me neighborhood which recently opened. I've never tried Venezuelan food. Got plenty of recommendations from Alejandro. Very nice service. He even gave me a fried cheese to try. My highlight was the game and cheese sandwich. The bread is made of cornmeal and very crispy. 

I plan to go back to try some other items. Very reasonably priced. Kudos!

Very delicious! I'm always excited to find new places with vegan options and I must say this hit the spot! Oh how I've missed arepas! The vegan arepa has black beans, sweet plantains, with fresh avocados. I went on my lunch break and it came with an amazing passion fruit juice to compliment my meal! I highly recommend this place

I didn't expect this place to be as good as it is. I ordered the special of the day which had chicken and a creamy sauce, the bread was soft in side and crispy outside. I will definitely try the other items on the menu.

I was on my way to Subway but decided to give this place a shot instead. BEST DECISION EVER. I got the vegan arepa. It has black beans, avocado and plantains. They serve it with some kind of smokey, almost barbecue cream sauce. It was sooooo good. The arepa was light and not at all dry like some places. I can't wait to go back.

Very authentic Venezuelan food (I also like Viva las Arepas, but this place is definitely more authentic and the food is definitely made with more love). The girl working the front was very nice. I would really give 4.5 stars based on the visit I had since the food was just delicious. The half star deduction would be for the wait (still totally worth it) and I got the wrong arepa (beef instead of the chicken I ordered, although it was tasty anyway so that was ok) will definitely be back!

My first time having Arepas...I am now a HUGE fan!

Park this bad boy next to Fukuburger and watch all the mindless suckers wait in line for overpriced / forgettable truck food.  Not here at Rika!

I tried 4 different Arepas and wasn't able to finish all 4 even sharing!  Meaning, portions are large here and filling!

My favorite EASILY was the Pabellon ($6): Shredded Beef, Black Beans, Sweet Plantains and Cheese. It seriously was amazing! I love the combination of black beans and plantains...perfection! 

Carne Guisada ($4.50): Stewed Shredded Beef. Everything was good, lots of juices in the Guisada.. Yum!  Prob my second fav :)

Pernil ($4): Roasted Pork with Tomato.  Flavor was plentiful in the Pernil...hard to go wrong with roast pork!  

Reina Pepiada ($4.50): Shredded Chicken Breast, Avocado, Green Peas, Mayo, and Parsley.  This was good...kind of like a chicken salad like mix, but good!

BEST truck food I've had in a LONG while!

Pics :

I went back and I will say, they had everything on the menu available and it was all good! I am a happy camper and the arepas were hot, no need to reheat. The chicken was perfect and the sauces were just as delish! I can't wait to go back. Now, I expect the same menu when I return, don't play with my feelings like that. Check out their website to see where to find them.

Thanks again to Amanda for finding this amazing food truck. It was worth leaving the gym early. The food was absolutely delicious, simple and cheap. Each arepa is about $4-4.50. It's very filling.

The foodie partner and I made a deal to get 2 arepas each so we can share and sample as much food as we can. We got a #1 Reina Pepiada, #3 Pernil, #4 Carne Guisada and #11 Pabellano. The arepa itself is nice, warm and crisp. Muy delicioso!

Reina Pepiada:
Cold chicken breast, mayo, peas, avocado and parsley. It's like a chicken salad in a corn flatbread (arepa). I don't even like mayo and peas but I did damage on this one.  The red sauce works great with this. 4/5

Pernil:
Roasted pork and tomatoes. Tasty chunks of pork full of flavor. Add cilantro sauce and red sauce  for more flavor. 5/5

Carne Guisada:
Shredded beef stew. Super tender and juicy beef. Cilantro sauce works great. 5/5 

Pabellano:
Beans, fried plantains, cheese and shredded beef. It's like the Carne Guisada arepa but packs a meaner punch and has more good stuff. I love fried plantains so I had to get this. You get that sweet, slightly caramelized banana...oh my. The best arepa!!! 5/5

After placing your order, it only takes 7-10 minutes for your food to be ready. They also have juices: mango, pineapple and passion fruit. They take credit cards. You can stalk them on Facebook.
So good! There is also vegan and glutten free options. It's about 7$ per arepa, but they are we'll sized, so it makes up for the price.

Que es la arepa? No se, until tonight, when we rushed over to the Las Vegas Farmer's market at Bruce Trent Park, corner of Rampart and Vegas, to catch Rika before they closed at 6:30pm.  By checking their website's calendar, I saw they would be in my neck of the woods. I had the vegan arepa with avocado, black beans, and plantains - muy delicioso! Plantains make everything alright, IMHO. I tried the b/f's Pabellon with shredded beef, black beans, plantains, and cheese-wowza! We're late to the arepa train, but we're on it now. You should take a ride, too! 
*Muchisimas gracias to Petra for the recommendation. That kid had good taste.

I love this truck and usually try to eat here when they are parked at the downtown Farmer's Market.  Their black beans and plantains are pretty much the best thing I've ever eaten in my ENTIRE LIFE!  And I'm a pig, so I know!

This was my second go at arepas, and I'm glad I gave them another shot! My first experience was okay, but I didn't love them. This place however has me craving arepas! 

I wasn't starving so I decided to forgo the meat and try the vegan- black beans, avocado and plantains. YUM! This combination was amazing! And the 2 sauces were the perfect addition! While I was hoping for a less filling meal, this sandwich was packed full, so I was pretty stuffed when I was done. These things don't look that big, but they're quite deceiving! 

Big thanks to Bad Beat for having them out in the parking lot. I hope this truck comes back to my neck of the woods soon so I can explore more of the menu!

Great food, and great service.  I had the cheese empanadas and the Reina arepa.  Delicious!  I will definitely be back! Especially since they are closer to my side of town.  I loved that it is a family owned and operated place and they definitely are friendly and helpful.

I tried rika express at first Friday this past week. I love arepas as I'm Colombian and grew up eating them :). I was excited to try the Venezuelan arepas but I must say I was a little disappointed. I asked for cheese only and I was shocked when they gave it to me with the cheese unmelted. The dough lacked flavor as well. I've been to viva las arepas which I thought were better but too greasy IMO.
